world.physics.collision

Class EntityCollision

  • java.lang.Object
    • world.physics.collision.Collision
      • world.physics.collision.EntityCollision

  • public final class EntityCollision
extends Collision
    A class of entity collisions extending collisions
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Tom Sydney Kerckhove & Xavier Goas Aguililla
    Invariant:
    Both entities of this entity collision are valid
        canHaveAsEntity(getEntity1()) && canHaveAsEntity(getEntity2())

    • Constructor Detail

      • EntityCollision

        public EntityCollision(World world,
               Entity entity1,
               Entity entity2)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new collision between entities.
        Parameters:
        world - The world in which collision occurs.
        entity1 - The first entity involved in the collision.
        entity2 - The second entity involved in the collision.
        Effects:
      • Initialize this collision with the given world
            super(world)
      • Set the first entity of this entity collision to the first entity.
            setEntity1(entity1)
      • Set the second entity of this entity collision to the second entity.
            setEntity2(entity2)
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - [CAN] The given world is not a valid world for this collision
            ! canHaveAsWorld(world)
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - [CAN] Any of the given entities is not a valid entity for this entity collision
            !canHaveAsEntity(entity1) || !canHaveAsEntity(entity2)

      • calculateCollisionTime

        protected void calculateCollisionTime()
                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Calculates the time to collision between two entities.
        Specified by:
        calculateCollisionTime in class Collision
        Postconditions:
      • The resulting time is not negative and different from Double.NaN
            Util.fuzzyLeq(0.0,new.getCollisionTime() && (! Double.isNaN(new.getCollisionTime()))
      • If the resulting time is finite, the distance between both ships would be fuzzy equal to zero if they would both move during the resulting time.
            if (new.getCollisionTime() < Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY) then
              Util.fuzzyEquals(this.distanceBetween(other,new.getCollisionTime()),0.0)
      • If the resulting distance is finite, the distance between both ships would be fuzzy different from zero if they would move for a time shorter than the resulting time.
            if (new.getCollisionTime() < Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY) then
              for each time in 0.0..result:
                if (time < new.getCollisionTime())
                  then ! Util.fuzzyEquals(getEntity1().distanceTo(getEntity2(),time),0.0)
      • If the resulting time is infinite, this ship is the same as the other ship or the distance between both ships would be different from zero for each finite time they would move.
            if (result == Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY) then
              (this == other) ||
              (for each time in 0.0..Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY:
                if (! Double.isInfinite(time)) then
                  (! Util.fuzzyEquals(this.distanceBetween(other,time),0.0))
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - [CAN] One of the given entities is null.
            ((entity1 == null) || (entity2 == null))

      • calculateCollisionPosition

        protected void calculateCollisionPosition()
        Sets the position at which two entities will collide.
        Specified by:
        calculateCollisionPosition in class Collision
        Effect:

            dt = time to collision
            p1, p2 = positions at collision time
            sigma = radius 1 + radius 2
            collisionPosition = p1 + ((radius 1 / sigma) (p2 - p1))
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - [CAN] One of the given entities is null.
            ((entity1 == null) || (entity1 == null))
